page.title: 10Horses and Riding.
page.content: Without doubt this is a horsey area, not only because the land is poor for intensive agriculture and bridleways are numerous, but because there is good riding country almost surrounding the area.Many units of 1 or 2 paddocks for a few horses have been bought as such ,or are leased, and it is common to see jumps set up.There are 2 livery stables each accomodating 15 horses and several for fewer horses, also a small but well known Arab stud farm. One sees a complete diversity of horses and all seem very well looked after. Many ride with the Wey Valley Riding Club and hunt with either of 2 packs coming into this area twice a season. Cross Country is the most usual event. For the many young riders there are Pony Clubs, occasionally joining for Pony Rallies which include jumping and riding lessons.
